properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a cluster of severe thunderstorms capable of producing quarter-sized hail and rainfall in excess of 50 mm. At 12:35 PM CST Doppler RADAR indicated that this cluster of severe thunderstorms stretched from Stewart Valley to Fiske and was moving toward the north at 20 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury.
Expires: 2019-08-22T20:59:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-22T18:35:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1672411025.2019
Area: R.M. of Lacadena including Kyle Tyner and Sanctuary, R.M. of Victory including Beechy, R.M. of Saskatchewan Landing including Stewart Valley, R.M. of Excelsior including Waldeck Rush Lake and Main Centre, R.M. of King George northwest of Lucky Lake, R.M. of Pleasant Valley including McGee and Fiske, R.M. of St Andrews including Rosetown and Zealandia, R.M. of Monet including Elrose Wartime and Forgan, R.M. of Snipe Lake including Eston and Plato
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing large hail. Thunderstorms moving through southwestern Saskatchewan this morning will pose a threat of hail to the size of loonies. Thunderstorms should weaken later this morning. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-22T22:59:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-22T15:01:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3094828051.2019

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Chemical Hazard Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: There is a small ammonia leak at a business located at #1 Alberta Road. The Town of Claresholm has declared a State of Local Emergency in order to be prepared for potential evacuation.
Expires: 2019-08-29T14:04:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Town of Claresholm, 2019-08-22T14:03:40-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6003
Area: Claresholm
properties.Author: Town of Claresholm

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 2:23 p.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms stretches from near Biggar to Big River is tracking very slowly to the northeast. Very heavy rainfall is likely with this line of slow moving thunderstorms, with amounts in excess of 50 mm per hour. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-08-22T23:18:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-22T20:24:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3773801391.2019
Area: R.M. of Spiritwood including Spiritwood and Leoville, R.M. of Canwood including Debden and Big River Res., R.M. of Meeting Lake, R.M. of Big River including Big River and Chitek Lake, R.M. of Douglas including Speers Richard and Alticane, R.M. of Mayfield including Maymont Denholm and Fielding, R.M. of Glenside north of Biggar
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. An intense low pressure centre is forecast to bring strong winds to Resolute and Grise Fiord. In Resolute southeasterly winds will strengthen tonight with gusts near 100 km/h possible by Friday morning. Winds will diminish Friday evening. Rain is also forecast with amounts near 20 mm. In Grise Fiord easterly winds are expected to reach, or possibly exceed, 100 km/h. Winds will develop overnight and are expected to diminish Friday night. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-23T11:25:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-22T19:26:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3100615611.2019
Area: Resolute, Grise Fiord
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Fog is expected to continue until late in the day. ### Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-22T23:44:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-22T15:46:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3662213929.2019
Area: Resolute
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. A trough of low pressure continues to support scattered thunderstorms over western Saskatchewan this afternoon. The threat for severe thunderstorms will shift eastwards this afternoon, where further development is expected. These thunderstorms will likely persist well into the evening and overnight hours bringing a threat for hail to the size of loonies and locally heavy rainfall in excess of 50 millimeters. This severe thunderstorm watch may be expanded eastwards later this evening as the event progresses. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-23T07:52:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-22T19:53:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2361804915.2019

properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms are expected to develop this afternoon with some having the potential to become severe, ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing large hail. Thunderstorms moving through southwestern Saskatchewan late this morning and early this afternoon have a history of producing nickel to quarter size hail in addition to locally heavy downpours. This severe thunderstorm watch may be expanded eastwards this afternoon as the event unfolds. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-22T22:59:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-22T17:36:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1423854250.2019
